alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 26 at 10:48PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Jordan Creek area in Juneau. * WHEN...Until 445 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Jordan Creek and possibly impacting the surrounding area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1040 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain along Jordan Creek. Rapid rises will cause flooding near Jordan Creek. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible through Tuesday morning. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 10:00pm the stage was 10.3 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.8 feet is expected late Tuesday morning. Impacts: At 10.5 feet: There will be some inundation of structures and roads near Jordan Creek with more than one foot of water. Some residential homes and commercial offices along the creek will see significant flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
